content.webTitle: Church of Ireland primate to retire at end of year

fields.headline: Church of Ireland primate to retire at end of year
fields.bodyText: The primate of the Church of Ireland, Archbishop Robin Eames, yesterday announced his intention to retire at the end of the year. He made his announcement at the end of his presidential address to the Church of Ireland synod which opened in Armagh. Lord Eames, 69, has been Archbishop of Armagh for almost 20 years. He said he would retire on December 31. Lord Eames is regarded as one of the most outstanding church leaders of the past century and has played a leading role in the wider Anglican church. The son of a Methodist minister, he was ordained in 1963.
